form.name: expressing_breastmilk
form.page_subtitle: CWC Counselling: Feeding A Healthy Child > Expressing Breastmilk

field.name: Expressing Breastmilk | Counseling
Wash your hands with soap & water Prepare clean containers
feeding_a_healthy_child/24.png
Pour boiling water into a cup
feeding_a_healthy_child/25.png
Pour out hot water from cup
feeding_a_healthy_child/26.png
Wash hands again with soap & water
feeding_a_healthy_child/27.png
Get comfortable
Gently stroke your breasts, a warm cloth may stimulate the flow of milk
Place cooled, clean cup under breast
feeding_a_healthy_child/28.png
Put your thumb on the breast above the dark area around nipple (areola) and other fingers on the underside of the breast behind areola:
feeding_a_healthy_child/29.png
With your thumb and first 2 fingers press a little bit in towards chest wall and then press gently towards areola
Milk may start to flow in drops, or sometimes in fine streams. Collect the milk in the clean cup
Avoid rubbing skin, which can cause bruising, or squeezing the nipple which will stop the flow of milk
Rotate the thumb and finger positions and press and release all around areola
feeding_a_healthy_child/30.png
Hold baby wrapped
Hold cup of milk to baby’s lips
Tip cup so milk reaches baby’s lips
Hold cup to the baby’s lips and let him or her take it
feeding_a_healthy_child/31.png
Keep expressed breast milk up to 8 hours in a cool place
Or up to 72 hours in the back of a refrigerator
